0.0: ... The eve of Passover adjacent to Mincha - The "smaller Mincha" - a little bit before Mincha, 1/2 hour at the beginning of the 10th hour, as we learnt [The Rashbam is proving what time this "smaller Mincha" is], [Pesachim 59a], the Tamid offering was slaughtered 8 1/2 hours into the day, and it was brought 9 1/2 hours into the day, it comes out, that Mincha [which is in place of the Tamid], is 9 1/2 into the day as well, and adjacent to it is: 1/2 before, the end of the 9th hour, and the beginning of the 1oth hour, [which is 9 hours into day].
0.1: ...One may not eat: So that he will eat the matzah that was commanded with a hearty appetite, so as to glorify the commandment.

2.0: Because of the obligation to eat matzah- so that you do not eat anything before the biblical obligation to eat matzah. As it says in shmot perek 12, "on the eve( of the first night) you shall eat matzah"
